title: Salmon Fish Cakes With Summer Greens Salad Recipe
summary: Salmon Fish Cakes With Summer Greens Salad Recipe might be just the main course you are searching for. One serving contains 281 calories, 12g of protein, and 16g of fat. This recipe serves 1. For $3.25 per serving, this recipe covers 47% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. It can be enjoyed any time, but it is especially good for The Fourth Of July. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, dairy free, and primal diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 10 minutes. This recipe from kitchendaily.com has 1 fans. Head to the store and pick up chicory, edamame and arugula, ready made salmon fish cakes, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the extra virgin olive oil you could follow this main course with the Peach Crisp: Healthy Crisp for Breakfast as a dessert. With a spoonacular score of 94%, this dish is super. Try Gammon Hot-pot Recipe (with Summer Greens), Dijon Fish Cakes With Greens, and Salmon Cakes with Greens for similar recipes.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish on the menu? Try pairing with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. The Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio with a 4.4 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 17 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santi Sortesele Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: Straw yellow hue, accompanied by a close-focused nose of pear, apricot and white flowers. The fruity palate, with top notes of stone fruit, shows ripeness and roundness well supported by an elegant acidity and savoriness, ensuring a long, lingering finish.
